virtuals.snippet: It should be obvious, but it isnâ€™tâ€¦
virtuals.subtitle: It should be obvious, but it isnâ€™tâ€¦
virtuals.emailSnippet:
â€¦

Stress is not a prerequisite for productivity. Itâ€™s definitely not a stand-in for it.

So what brought us here? I believe itâ€™s a byproduct of growing up in a factory-based society. From home to school to work doing meaningless chores, jobs, and tasks where the parents, teachers, foremen and managers gauge our work by how â€˜busyâ€™ (stressed out) we appear.

Yelling makes us look productive when our jobs are to look busy.

content.subtitle: True insight is a natural (but not a normal) occasion.

virtuals.snippet: True insight is a natural (but not a normal) occasion.
virtuals.subtitle: True insight is a natural (but not a normal) occasion.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
True insight comes from the unknown.

True insight provides a vision for discovery, not a destination.

True insight is much more than just an answer to a preexisting question.

True insight kicks down the door and tosses up a whole new paradigm â€” an entirely fresh foundation to stand on and view the world.

True insight shows up as an opening â€” a new space for being.

True insight comes, not from a question, but from an inquiry into the nature of being thatâ€™s not about producing solutionsâ€¦

paragraphs.name: eb35
paragraphs.text: True insight is a natural (but not a normal) occasion.

content.subtitle: What if we arenâ€™t the ones doing the thinking, but instead, are being thunk by this thing â€” this phenomenon â€” called thought?

virtuals.snippet: What if we arenâ€™t the ones doing the thinking, but instead, are being thunk by this thing â€” this phenomenon â€” called thought?
virtuals.subtitle: What if we arenâ€™t the ones doing the thinking, but instead, are being thunk by this thing â€” this phenomenon â€” called thought?
virtuals.emailSnippet:
How would that change the way you see your human experience?

Would it seem lighter? More intimidating? Neither?

I used to think I could release bad thoughts.

Until I tried. And they grew in intensity.

Seeing thought as a type of mental heartbeat changed things for me (and made a lot of sense). Hereâ€™s how it seems to workâ€¦

Thoughts come through the screen of our awareness.

Tha-thump. Tha-thump.

content.subtitle: This is it... This is the moment.

virtuals.snippet: This is it... This is the moment.
virtuals.subtitle: This is it... This is the moment.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
The ego has hooked you like a fish.

Youâ€™re totally caught up in its net.

Enraptured by a story and a corresponding emotion so strong. So concrete. So seemingly real.

That you wonâ€™t allow yourself to be free.

You hear a whisper from that Higher voice. So faint. But so direct.

Lay your story down.

It only says it once. If youâ€™re lucky â€” twice.

Almost immediately, the ego chimes back in. Louder.

paragraphs.name: da1c
paragraphs.text: This is it... This is the moment.

content.subtitle: Our logical, personal minds are largely descriptive. Itâ€™s all about x,y,z, whatâ€™s in front of us at the time, our identity at the momentâ€¦

virtuals.subtitle: Our logical, personal minds are largely descriptive. Itâ€™s all about x,y,z, whatâ€™s in front of us at the time, our identity at the momentâ€¦
virtuals.emailSnippet:
, and connecting the dots that are on the paper â€” right here, right now.

Itâ€™s brilliant at describing things... Like, everything.

Iâ€™m thankful for the descriptive mind. It helps me stay alive. It sees threats and labels them so I can get outta dodge before things get real. It tells me that red lights mean stop and green lights mean go.

Itâ€™s awesome, really.

If we largely live from the descriptive mind, we can get really good at describing stuff.

virtuals.emailSnippet:
abandon.

And then, sheâ€™s fine. The sun comes back up. Her blue eyes shine again. And all is well in toddler-land.

It never ceases to ASTOUND me how, when that thunderstorm passes, itâ€™s long gone. Not a cloud in sight.

What have I learned from my little guru because of this fascinating behavioral trait?

Thought just passes through (if we let it).

We do this naturally as kids, but when we become â€˜socializedâ€™ we teach ourselves to hold on to our pain so as to (a) avoid embarrassment and (bâ€¦

content.subtitle: Itâ€™s almost always more simple than we make it.

virtuals.snippet: Itâ€™s almost always more simple than we make it.
virtuals.subtitle: Itâ€™s almost always more simple than we make it.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
In our work... In our relationships... In our financesâ€¦ In our healthâ€¦ In our lives...

I like being what I call, â€˜curiously dumbâ€™ about things.

When I allow myself to be curiously dumb, things â€˜occurâ€™ to me more. Fresh thinking seems to happen more than when I think I have it (or should have it) all figured out.

I guess this is my way of expressing the whole â€˜empty cupâ€™ concept.

Most of us have been raised to believe that â€” in order to know something, we have to fill our brains full ofâ€¦

content.subtitle: I was going to write this post all on my own, but I realized Shel Silverstein said it bestâ€¦

virtuals.subtitle: I was going to write this post all on my own, but I realized Shel Silverstein said it bestâ€¦
virtuals.emailSnippet:
â€¦

Whatif

Last night, while I lay thinking here,
Some Whatifs crawled inside my ear
And pranced and partied all night long
And sang their same old Whatif song:
Whatif Iâ€™m dumb in school?
Whatif theyâ€™ve closed the swimming pol?
Whatif I get beat up?
Whatif thereâ€™s poison in my cup?
Whatif I start to cry?
Whatif I get sick and die?
Whatif I flunk that test?
Whatif green hair grows on my chest?
Whatif nobody likes me?
